    • <<<<<<< HEAD 
      public class LonelyTwitterActivity
extends Activity
      This class is the main view class in lonelyTwitter class. It deals with user inputs, saves/loads them in/from the file FILENAME (file.sav).

      You can access this file from Android Device Monitor. 

       pre-formatted    text
      pseudo-code that is used in this class is as follows:
      step 1
      step 2
      1. first item
      2. second item
      3. third item

      • second item
      • third item
      Since:
      1.4
      Author:
      Michelle

      NormalTweet, BufferedReader, TweetList
      ======= 
      public class LonelyTwitterActivity
extends Activity
      This class is the main view class of the project.
      In this class, user interaction and file manipulation is performed. All files are in the form of "json" files that are stored in Emulator's accessible from Android Device Monitor: 
           File Explorer -> data -> data -> ca.ualberta.cs.lonelytwitter -> files -> file.sav.
      begin
      some pseudo code
      end.       The file name is indicated in the           FILENAME conostant.
      • item 1
      • item 2
      • item 3
      1. item 1
      2. item 2
      3. item 3
      Since:
      1.0
      Version:
      1.4.2
      Author:
      Ali Sajedi
      See Also:
      Tweet

        • FILENAME

          private static final java.lang.String FILENAME
          <<<<<<< HEAD
          This is the name of the file that is saved in your virtual device. You can access it through Android Device Monitor by selecting your app, then data -> data -> file.sav
          See Also:
          NormalTweet, Constant Field Values
          =======
          The file that all the tweets are saved there. The format of the file is JSON.
          See Also:
          loadFromFile(), saveInFile(), Constant Field Values

          <<<<<<< HEAD
          This method starts after the app first gets created. It will call the method that loads the json file and generates the tweets from its contents. It creates an Array Adapter and displays it through the ListView.
